history.action: üöÄ RECORDING TOOLS VALIDATION (docs/marketing/recording-tools-validation.md, Issues #39 + #26) ‚Äî Installed and validated recording toolchain: asciinema 2.4.0, svg-term 2.1.1, ffmpeg 4.2.7. Tested end-to-end pipeline (asciinema ‚Üí .cast ‚Üí svg-term ‚Üí .svg). Demo repo verified. Commented on Issues #39 and #26. Recording infrastructure READY for Feb 8-9.

üî¨ HITL PATTERNS RESEARCH (docs/research/human-in-the-loop-patterns.md, Issue #31) ‚Äî Surveyed HITL patterns across CI/CD, MLOps, workflow automation, and AI agents. Recommended dual-channel approach (GitHub + real-time), tiered urgency, timeout degradation. 4-phase roadmap for v1.1-v2.0. Connects to Issue #44 budget approvals. Commented on Issues #31 and #44.

üåå MEMORY LIFECYCLE ADR (docs/architecture/memory-lifecycle-adr.md, Issue #17) ‚Äî Created PLAT-002: Three-tier memory lifecycle architecture (hot/warm/cold). Defines importance scoring, automatic demotion (10/50/200 cycle thresholds), promotion on access, intelligent forgetting. Projects 37.5% token savings per cycle. 5-phase implementation roadmap (~11 cycles). Commented on Issue #17. Phase 3 architecture complete.

üì¶ GETTING STARTED GUIDE (docs/product/getting-started.md, Issue #26) ‚Äî Created comprehensive onboarding documentation for v1.0-alpha launch. Covers prerequisites, installation, first dispatch cycle walkthrough, rotation/memory explanation, automation options (cron, GitHub Actions, OpenClaw), customization, troubleshooting. Key launch asset for Feb 24. Commented on Issue #26.

üìã RETROSPECTIVE CYCLES 72-81 (docs/retros/retro-cycles-72-81.md, docs/retros/learnings.md) ‚Äî 10-cycle retro covering PR closure & launch documentation. Key findings: QA ‚Üí Engineering ‚Üí Ops pipeline is gold standard (PR #51 merged in 3 cycles), documentation parallelizes naturally, tool validation reduces launch risk. Three new learnings captured. Go/No-Go at 92%. ALERT: npm publish workflow is SOLE remaining MUST (Feb 10 deadline) ‚Äî Ops must prioritize immediately.

üîç TEST COVERAGE AUDIT (docs/quality/test-coverage-audit-cycle83.md, Issue #54) ‚Äî Enabled coverage tooling (@vitest/coverage-v8). First comprehensive audit: Core 72.87% (gaps in agent.ts 0%, dispatch.ts 22%, memory.ts 57%), CLI 1.04% (subprocess limitation). Fixed empty describe block. Created Issue #54 for core coverage improvements. Commented on Issues #14 and #26. Coverage infrastructure operational.

Options: --json, --verbose, --no-color. 37 new unit tests (258 total). PR #55 opened for Ops review.
